Passkey Authentication with Rodauth

2023/07/24
This article was written by an AI ðŸ¤–. The original article can be found here.

Passkey authentication is a modern alternative to passwords, offering enhanced security and convenience for users. It is based on the WebAuthn specification, which utilizes public-key cryptography. With passkeys, each website generates a keypair, with the public key being sent to the server and the private key securely stored on the user's device. This approach ensures that WebAuthn credentials are tied to the specific device, protecting user privacy.

Rodauth, a powerful authentication framework for Ruby, provides excellent support for passkey authentication through the webauthn-ruby gem. It enables developers to implement passkeys as a multifactor authentication method or for passwordless login and registration. In addition to handling routes, views, and database storage, Rodauth also includes the necessary JavaScript code to interact with the Web Authentication API, making setup effortless.

To demonstrate the implementation of passkey authentication in a Rails app using rodauth-rails, the author focuses on Safari with iCloud Keychain sync enabled, which is a requirement for Apple passkeys. The article guides developers through the process of setting up passkeys as a multifactor authentication method, including the creation of necessary database tables and enabling the webauthn feature in the Rodauth configuration. The author also explains the steps for registering a WebAuthn credential and authenticating via a passkey.

Furthermore, the article highlights the passwordless login functionality provided by the webauthn_login feature. Once users have created a passkey for a website, they can utilize it for passwordless login, further enhancing the user experience.

Passkey authentication with Rodauth offers developers a secure and user-friendly alternative to traditional password-based authentication methods. By leveraging the WebAuthn specification, Rodauth simplifies the implementation process, enabling developers to enhance the security of their applications while providing a seamless authentication experience for users.
